patterns: What are the requirements for each undergraduate program offered by the College of Industrial Technology?
Can you provide the admission requirements for the programs in the College of Industrial Technology?
What are the prerequisites for the undergraduate programs in the College of Industrial Technology?
What GPA do I need to meet for admission to the programs in the College of Industrial Technology?
Are there specific grade requirements for each undergraduate program at the College of Industrial Technology?
I'm curious about the eligibility criteria for the undergraduate programs in the College of Industrial Technology. Can you help?
What qualifications are needed to apply for the undergraduate programs at the College of Industrial Technology?
Could you give me an overview of the admission criteria for the programs offered by the College of Industrial Technology?
What grades should I have to apply for the undergraduate programs in the College of Industrial Technology?
Tell me about the academic prerequisites for admission to the programs in the College of Industrial Technology.
responses:
Certainly! üìö The admission requirements for undergraduate programs offered by the College of Industrial Technology (CIT) vary depending on the specific program. Here are the general grade requirements for each program:

- Bachelor of Science in Food Technology: 80 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM); 85 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (Non-STEM)
- Bachelor of Engineering Technology majors:
  - Computer Engineering Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Civil Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Electrical Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Electronics Communications Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Electronics Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Instrumentation and Control Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Mechanical Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Mechatronics Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Railway Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
  - Mechanical Engineering Technology options:
    - Automotive Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
    - Foundry Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
    - Heating Ventilating & Air-Conditioning/Refrigeration Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
    - Power Plant Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
    - Welding Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
    - Dies and Moulds Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English (STEM and Non-STEM)
- Bachelor of Technology in Apparel and Fashion: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English
- Bachelor of Technology in Nutrition and Food Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English
- Bachelor of Technology in Print Media Technology: 75 above GPA on Math, Science, and English

For more detailed information about specific program requirements, please refer to the [official website of TUP](https://tup.edu.ph/undergraduate/admission/undergraduate-programs)

patterns: What are the requirements for undergraduate programs in the College of Industrial Education (CIE)?
Can you provide the prerequisites for CIE undergraduate programs?

What are the entrance requirements for CIE undergraduate programs?
Could you detail the criteria for admission to CIE undergraduate programs?
responses:
Certainly! üìö The admission requirements for undergraduate programs offered by the College of Industrial Education (CIE) vary depending on the specific program. Here are the general grade requirements for each program:
- Bachelor of Science Industrial Education major in Information and Communication Technology
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Science Industrial Education major in Home Economics
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Science Industrial Education major in Industrial Arts
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Animation
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Beauty Care and Wellness
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Computer Programming
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Electrical
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Electronics
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Food Service Management
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Fashion and Garment
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Vocational Teachers Education major in Heat Ventilation & Air Conditioning
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

- Bachelor of Technical Teacher Education
  Requirements:
  - Grade Requirement: 85 above GPA

The grade requirement for admission to these programs is an 85 above GPA.
Each program has specific course descriptions and program educational outcomes. For more detailed information, please refer to the official website of TUP.
For specific admission requirements and prerequisites, please visit the official TUP website or contact the Office of Admissions directly.
The grade requirement applies to all programs within the College of Industrial Education (CIE).
For more detailed information about specific program requirements, please refer to the [official website of TUP](https://tup.edu.ph/undergraduate/admission/undergraduate-programs)

patterns: What are the admission requirements for undergraduate programs in the College of Liberal Arts (CLA)?
Can you tell me the requirements for CLA undergraduate programs?

What are the eligibility criteria for CLA undergraduate programs?
Can you list the requirements for admission to CLA undergraduate programs?
What are the grade requirements for CLA undergraduate programs?
responses:
Certainly! üìö The admission requirements for undergraduate programs offered by the College of Liberal Arts (CLA) vary depending on the specific program. Here are the general grade requirements for each program:
- Bachelor of Arts in Management major in Industrial Management:
  - Grade Requirement: 80 above GPA in English, 80 above GWA (General Weighted Average), ABM, GAS, HUMMS preferably
- Bachelor of Science in Entrepreneurship Management:
  - Grade Requirement: 80 above GPA in English, 80 above GWA, ABM, GAS, HUMMS preferably
- Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management:
  - Grade Requirement: 80 above GPA in English
  - Additional Requirements:
    - Height: 5'4" for Female, 5'6" for Male
    - A 2-minute introduction video in corporate attire is required. False information on height will lead to disqualification from the program.
For more detailed information about specific program requirements, please refer to the [official website of TUP](https://tup.edu.ph/undergraduate/admission/undergraduate-programs)
